about.description:
The capturer package makes it easy to capture the stdout and stderr streams
of the current process and subprocesses. Output can be relayed to the terminal
in real time but is also available to the Python program for additional
processing.
about.summary: Easily capture stdout/stderr of the current process and subprocesses.

name: capturer
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.4" %}

package:
  name: capturer
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/c/capturer/capturer-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 090142a58f3f85def3a7dd55d9024d0d1a86d1a88aaf9317c0f146244994a615

build:
  number: 1000
  skip: True  # [win]
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed --no-cache-dir -vvv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - humanfriendly >=2.1

test:
  imports:
    - capturer

about:
  home: https://capturer.readthedocs.org
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Easily capture stdout/stderr of the current process and subprocesses.'
  description: |
    The capturer package makes it easy to capture the stdout and stderr streams
    of the current process and subprocesses. Output can be relayed to the terminal
    in real time but is also available to the Python program for additional
    processing.
  dev_url: https://github.com/xolox/python-capturer
  doc_url: https://capturer.readthedocs.org

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ocefpaf
    - nehaljwani
